item.title: About
item.author: email@example.com (cunhazera dev blog)
item.description:
Hey, there! I’m Gabriel, a software engineer, with over 10 years of experience, focused on backend development with JVM-languages.

I’m particularly interested in building applications with Java, Spring/Quarkus and Hibernate.

If you want to connect with me, follow/add me in my socials:

ðŸ’» https://t.co/dcyMtqt8w8
ðŸ”— https://t.co/HRQdqJ9EDi

— Gabriel Cunha (@cunhazera) January 19, 2026

Is there anything I can help? Consulting, mentorship, just a quick chat about tech and career? Book a time and let’s talk!

item.title: Rich Content 2
item.author: email@example.com (cunhazera dev blog)
item.description: Hugo ships with several Embedded Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.author: email@example.com (cunhazera dev blog)
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.author: email@example.com (cunhazera dev blog)
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.author: email@example.com (cunhazera dev blog)
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.author: email@example.com (cunhazera dev blog)
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
